chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert B. Sherrod was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert B. Sherrod is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert B. Sherrod was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent to Ct. 5 in 15CF562.
Credit for 9 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  *  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1636.00 plus surcharges; joint & several w/14CF1335 and 14CF1391.
May not have contact with Dwayne W, Charles R-K, Steven B, EB dob 6-28-97, Matthew B, Alec E, Monica A, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is amended to strike the use of a dangerous weapon enhancer, cts 1, 3, 4 and 5 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions, concurrent to ct 5 in 15CF562; restitution ordered in the amount of $1,636.00 (by stipulation of deft) joint & several with 14CF1391/14CF1335; bond is reinstated and applied to restitution; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; credit for 9 days served if revoked.
